name: Notorious Who Am 'I's Quiz | Thematic Fun | 10 Questions

questions.text: I was the leader of the brutal regime known as the Khmer Rouge. Who Am I?
questions.explanation:
Pol Pot.

	Pol Pot ruled Cambodia in the 1970s and was responsible for the extermination of millions of innocent people.

questions.text: I co-starred with my husband, Charles Bronson in movies. My surname is a country. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Jill Ireland.

	Jill Ireland's life was cut short by cancer.

questions.text: I was in several movies, but I am probably best remembered for slapping an L.A. traffic cop. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Zsa Zsa Gabor.

	Zsa Zsa starred in the original 'Moulin Rouge' and is known for her temper tantrums.

questions.text: I started the Bull Moose Party, was governor of New York and president of the United States. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Theodore Roosevelt.

	Teddy is buried on the scenic north shore of Long Island. The Teddy Bear was named after him. Teddy was one of America's greatest presidents and one of the true old fashioned heroes.

questions.text: I was said to have been born in a ladies room at a party. I went on to become one of the 20th century's most influential figures. I popularised the term 'Iron Curtain'. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Winston Churchill.

	Britain's wartime inspirational leader is one of history's most recognisable figures, with his victory sign and huge cigars.

questions.text: I have been Moses, Michelangelo, and a tv Colby too. I am a seasoned professional and if you like guns I am the man for you. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Charlton Heston.

	Oscar winner for 'Ben Hur' in 1959, and president of the Screen Actors Guild from 1966 to 1971.

questions.text: I became one of Britain's favorite comedians famed for my slapstick routines and Hitler impersonations, but am perhaps more famous for eating someone's hamster. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Freddie Starr.

	Freddie also does a great Elvis.

questions.text: Serving time in a federal prison, I was known as the 'Teflon Don' until the law caught up with me. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
John Gotti.

	Well... there was the time when...BANG! BANG! AGHHHHH!

questions.text: I sailed from Western Europe and became famous for being the first man to circumnavigate the globe, although I never finished the voyage. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Ferdinand Magellan.

	This intrepid Portugese explorer was the first to negotiate the treacherous waters around Cape Horn.

questions.text: I was a French peasant girl who had a vision in a cave. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Bernardette De Lourdes.

	Saint Bernardette is responsible for creating one of the world's premier pilgrimage sites.
